description:
Hi,

We have two openstack setups, icehouse and kilo.

I have been facing an issue in icehouse, that the keypair I created and used, got deleted when I tried to use it again. I faced this situation three times where I created a keypair and the next day it got deleted.

The keypair I have been using for kilo was available for about one and half month and got deleted yesterday and so I created a new keypair. But when I checked the new keypair today, it was also got deleted today.

Checked the logs and have no clue what is going on!. 

Do anyone have any idea, what is happening?.

ii  nova-api                             2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - API frontend
ii  nova-cert                            2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - certificate management
ii  nova-common                          2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - common files
ii  nova-conductor                       2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - conductor service
ii  nova-consoleauth                     2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - Console Authenticator
ii  nova-novncproxy                      2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - NoVNC proxy
ii  nova-scheduler                       2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - virtual machine scheduler
ii  python-nova                          2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute Python libraries
ii  python-novaclient                    2:2.30.1-1~cloud0                     all          client library for OpenStack Compute API


Thank you
title: Keypairs automatically getting deleted

comments.content:
Hi,

We have two openstack setups, icehouse and kilo.

I have been facing an issue in icehouse, that the keypair I created and used, got deleted when I tried to use it again. I faced this situation three times where I created a keypair and the next day it got deleted.

The keypair I have been using for kilo was available for about one and half month and got deleted yesterday and so I created a new keypair. But when I checked the new keypair today, it was also got deleted today.

Checked the logs and have no clue what is going on!. 

Do anyone have any idea, what is happening?.

ii  nova-api                             2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - API frontend
ii  nova-cert                            2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - certificate management
ii  nova-common                          2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - common files
ii  nova-conductor                       2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - conductor service
ii  nova-consoleauth                     2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - Console Authenticator
ii  nova-novncproxy                      2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - NoVNC proxy
ii  nova-scheduler                       2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - virtual machine scheduler
ii  python-nova                          2:12.0.1-0ubuntu1~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute Python libraries
ii  python-novaclient                    2:2.30.1-1~cloud0                     all          client library for OpenStack Compute API


Thank you
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~adaikal-raj

comments.content: Can you provide logs and steps to reproduce?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mszankin

comments.content:
Hi Maciej,

Looks like the problem is with docker machine driver. It is the culprit for deleting the keypairs. 

https://github.com/rancher/rancher/issues/4925

https://github.com/docker/machine/issues/3261

Sorry, thought it was with openstack.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~adaikal-raj
